ovdesc.p: This Table holds the required data related to each forms transmitter, receptor details.

desc.p: Valid id of the USREGS.IRS.FORM.TYPE table.
Shows the transmitters nine digit Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN).
Shows the five-character alphanumeric Transmitter Control Code (TCC) assigned by IRS.
This field is required for test files only.
Enter a ‘T’ if this is a test file; otherwise leave it blank.
Radio button with values T and None. Default value is None.
Shows whether the transmitter is a foreign entity or not.
Enter a ‘1’ if the transmitter is a foreign entity. If not leave it blank.
Radio button with values 1 and None. Default value is none.
Shows any additional information that may be part of the name
The name of the company associated with the address where correspondence should be sent.
Shows any additional information that may be part of the name of the company where correspondence should be sent.
Displays the mailing address where the correspondence should be sent.
City name of the company address
Shows the state name of the company’s correspondence Drop down US.STATE>@ID
Mandatory field if T.COUNTRY.CODE is blank
If not entered, throw the error message “State code is mandatory if there is no country code”
The postal code of the company’s correspondence address
Enter the valid nine digit zip assigned by the U.S. postal service.
Shows the country code for foreign transmitter
Enter the name of the person to be contacted if IRS encounters problems with the file or transmission.
Shows the telephone number of the person to contact.
Shows the email address of the person to contact regarding the electronic or magnetic files.
Indicates if the software used to produce this file was provided by a vendor or produced in house
V – Your software was purchased from a vendor or other source.
I – Your software was produced by in house programmers.
The name of the company from whom the software was purchase.
If the software is produced in-house, leave blank.
Shows the mailing address of vendor
If the software is produced in-house, leave blank.
Shows the city, town, or post office of vendor
Shows the valid U.S. Postal Service state abbreviation for vendor address.
Shows the valid nine digit ZIP code assigned by the U.S Postal service for the vendor address
The name of the person who can be contacted concerning any software questions.
The telephone number of the person to contact concerning software questions.
Indicates whether the vendor is a foreign entity or not
Radio button with values 1 and None.
Default value is 1.Enter a ‘1’ if the vendor is a foreign entity. Otherwise leave it blank.
Shows whether the filing Combined Federal/State Filer. Required for the combined federal / state filing program.
Enter ‘1’ if approved or submitting a test to participate in the combined federal / state filing program; otherwise leave it blank.
Shows the valid nine digit Tax payer Identification.
Shows the four characters of the name control
Indicates whether the payer is filing information returns electronically last year or not
Enter a ‘1’ if this is the last year this payer name and TIN will file information returns, else leave it blank.
Indicates whether the payer is a foreign entity or not
Enter a ‘1’ if the payer is a foreign entity and income is paid by foreign entity to a U.S. resident. Otherwise, leave it blank.
Displays the name of the payer whose TIN appears in the A record.
Indicates the name of the transfer or paying agent for the agent indicator contains a ‘1’.
If the transfer agent indicator (field 52) contains a ‘1’ then this field must contain the name of the transfer (or paying) agent.
Indicates the whether the entity is the transfer agent or not
Mandatory field. Can be either 1 or 0.
1 – The entity in the second payer name field is the transfer agent.
0 – The entity shown is not the transfer agent.
Shows the email address of the person to contact regarding the electronic or magnetic files.
If the transfer agent indicator is ‘1’ then enter the shipping address of the transfer agent. Otherwise enter the actual shipping address of the payer.
Shows the state name of the transfer agent
Mandatory field. Enter the valid U.S. Postal Service state abbreviations.
The valid nine digit ZIP code assigned by the U.S. Postal service.
Shows the payers phone number and extension
Aggregate totals of the state income tax withheld field in the payee ‘B’ records.
Aggregate totals of the local income tax withheld field in the payee ‘B’ records.
Displays Postal or ZIP Code for withholding agent’s address
